resource.name: High Cost Disbursements
resource.description: This dataset provides information about total dollars disbursed to Eligible Telecommunication Carriers (ETCs) within the High Cost Program by month and year since January 2003.
columns_description: Amount of funding disbursed to carriers. The “amount disbursed” may occasionally show a negative number. This is a result of prior period adjustments, audit recoveries, or other factors.
Month of disbursement to carrier.
State abbreviation for carrier receiving High Cost support.
Unique number assigned to each ETC based on its service area. A carrier with multiple service areas within a single state will have multiple SAC.
FCC Form 498 ID (also called a Service Provider Identification Number or SPIN) is a unique nine-digit number assigned to a service provider by USAC when the service provider files an FCC Form 498.
Year of disbursement to carrier.
Standard name used to identify a study area. Typically, the study area name is the same as the carrier name.
Individual High Cost fund in which the carrier participates. See High Cost Funds Glossary for details.

domain_tags: connect america fund broadband loop support

domain_metadata.value: This dataset provides information about total dollars disbursed to Eligible Telecommunication Carriers (ETCs) within the High Cost Program by month and year since January 2003. Use this dataset to answer questions such as: What disbursements has an ETC received from USAC? What type of High Cost support does each state receive?

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset field is described with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0 to 100 percent. Any value less than 100 percent indicates a field with missing values.

domain_metadata.value: This dataset contains information from the basic information section of each FCC Form 470, including applicant details such as contact information, application number, Billed Entity Number (BEN), and funding year, and related information from the E-rate Productivity Center (EPC).  Use this dataset to answer questions such as: What is the contact information of the applicant? Who is the technical contact for the applicant? When was the applicant’s FCC Form 470 certified? All data contained within the Basic Information (FCC Form 470) dataset is self-reported by applicants.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset field is described with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0 -100%. Any value less than 100% indicates a field with missing values. In most cases, missing values are the result of “not required” fields.

resource.name: Lifeline Companies Near Me
resource.description:
This dataset provides the service type and contact information for self-reported Eligible Telecommunication Carriers (ETCs) offering Lifeline services by zip code, city, county, and state. If you need assistance with a Lifeline application, are experiencing a Lifeline service issue, or have a problem with your Lifeline provider, please visit our help page: 
https://www.lifelinesupport.org/ls/help/default.aspx
columns_description: Full legal name of the carrier.
Customer service phone number of the carrier.
Type of service provided by the carrier. It may be wireless or wireline.
City of the area where the carrier provides service.
State where a Study Area Code (SAC) is designated.
Zip code of the area where the carrier provides service.
County of the area where the carrier provides service.
URL of the carrier’s website.

domain_metadata.value: This dataset provides the information of all the carriers providing Lifeline service, their customer service number, service type, state, and URL for a particular zip code. The purpose of this dataset is to provide the most accurate list of carriers providing service in a particular area within a given state, through the use of zip codes. To ensure that this data is up-to-date and accurate, it is refreshed periodically to add new carriers and the corresponding zip codes of their designated service areas, update the zip codes for existing carriers, and remove zip codes for carriers that have relinquished their ETC designation. In the event that a user enters a zip code that does not return any service provider(s), a complete listing of the state in which the zip code is found will be returned with the recommendation that the consumer confirm the availability of Lifeline in their chosen zip code with a service provider from that state.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset field is described with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0 to 100 percent. Any value less than 100 percent indicates a field with missing values.   The zip codes contained within this dataset represent ~ 93 percent of all zip codes, nationally.

resource.name: E-rate Request for Discount on Services: FRN Status (FCC Form 471 and Related Information)
resource.description: This dataset contains information about the Funding Request Number (FRN) listed within each FCC Form 471 and related information from the E-rate Productivity Center (EPC).
columns_name: FRN Total Monthly Recurring Eligible Costs
FCDL Comment for FCC Form 471 Application
FRN Total Monthly Recurring Ineligible Costs
FRN Total Pre-Discount Eligible Recurring Cost
FRN Total Pre-Discount Eligible One-Time Costs
Award based on State Master Contract
columns_description: Total amount disbursed to a service provider or applicant.
A number that indicates which appeal wave the revised funding decision was issued in.
Unique # assigned to the FCC Form 486
Service start date from the FCC Form 471 Application.
Discount rate applied to service or equipment for the FRN.
Total ineligible one-time costs for the FRN level.

Total pre-discount eligible monthly recurring charges of a funding request. This field can be aggregated at an FRN level to generate metrics across service type or entities. This field should not be used to generate metrics at FRN line Item level.
Estimated start date of services on 471 application. Service start date will impact commitment amount as it will adjust the month of services.
Service provider name for the FRN.
Number of bids received by the applicant from service providers in the competitive bidding process.
Nickname given to an FRN by an applicant when filling their FCC Form 471.
Unique application number is generated at the time an applicant begins to file FCC Form 471. Applicants can request funding for multiple services under the same application number.
Date the applicant FCDL was revised
Explanation of FCDL decision at the form level. MR: management reason; CR: cancelled reason; DR: denial reason.
A number that indicates which wave sequence the funding commitment was issued in.
Last date an Invoice (BEAR or SPI) can be received or postmarked
Total distance between a demark point at an applicant’s location and a service provider’s switching facility or point of presence measured in feet.
The total amount for the Funding Request (FRN) after discount.

Total pre-discount ineligible monthly recurring charges of a funding request. This field can be aggregated at an FRN level to generate metrics across service type or entities. This field should not be used to generate metrics at FRN line Item level.
Narrative for the FRN describing the products and services.
Services must be installed or product must be delivered on or before this date.

Contract expiration date for the FRN. If the FRN is for a tariff or month-to-month service this field displays the service end date. This field can be used to filter the 471 applications that have active contracts.
Type of restriction that enable applicants to make pricing information confidential such as State Law or Statute, Local Rule, Court Order, Contract Executed with Restrictive Terms.
Email Address of the main contact provided by the applicant on the FCC Form 471.
Applicant organization name.
Contract expiration date for contracts that can be extended.
FCC Form 470 application number for the FRN submitted in the legacy system (FY2015 and earlier).
Status of the funding request. It includes pending, funded, denied or cancelled.
Unique funding request number associated with the FCC Form 471.
The date of the wave that a funding commitment was issued in.
Program provides 1 to 1 dollar match amount in extra Category One fiber special construction funding up to an additional ten percent discount.

Type of invoice to be processed for FRN (SPI: Service Provider Invoice – FCC Form 474, BEAR: Billed Entity Applicant Reimbursement Form – FCC Form 472, or NOT SET (when no form has been received yet for the FY and therefore no invoicing mode has been set).
Contract number for the FRN. It can used to filter records related to a specific contract number.
Applicant's state.
Remaining number of contract extensions for the FRN.

Date a user associated with the BEN clicked on
the file in the Newsfeed in EPC to generate the
FCDL
Indicates the review status of the Funding request. Pending Reason is limited to Current (Committed) forms.
Number of eligible fiber strands.
Number of actual glass optical fibers inside the cable sheath.
Average cost of cabling, infrastructure, and associated hardware divided by the total project plant route feet.

Total pre-discount charges of a funding request. This field can be aggregated at an FRN level to generate metrics across service type or entities. This field should not be used to generate metrics at FRN line Item level.

Total one-time/non-recurring charge of a funding request. This field can be aggregated at an FRN level to generate metrics across service type or entities. This field should not be used to generate metrics at FRN line Item level.
Total pre-discounted eligible recurring charges of a funding request. It is derived by multiplying the month of service and the pre-discounted monthly recurring charges.

Total pre-discount monthly recurring charges of a funding request. This field can be aggregated at an FRN level to generate metrics across service type, status or entities. This field should not be used to generate metrics at FRN line item level.
The date the contract was awarded by the applicant to service provider.
FCC Form 470 application number for the FRN submitted in EPC (FY2016 and later).
Unique number assigned to the billed entity/ applicant.
Fiber subtypes for fiber FRNs.  Options include maintenance and operation, network equipment, network equipment and maintenance, or special construction.
Billing account number for the billed entity.
FRN service type including voice, data transmission and/or Internet access, basic maintenance of internal connections, internal connections, or managed internal broadband services.
Indicates whether the application has been certified in the window.
Total pre-discount eligible non-recurring/one-time charges of a funding request.
Number of months a service is provided during a funding year for an FRN based on the service start date and end date.
Number of months left on the contract for the FRN.
Percentage of discount that is matched by USAC for fiber FRNs under the state matching provision.
A unique nine-digit number assigned to identify the service provider.
Indicates whether FRN is for leased dark fiber or IRU (Indefensible Right of Use).
Indicates whether the contract for the FRN is based on a state master contract.
Applicant's organization type.
Amount financed for fiber FRNs.

Form status for the FCC Form 486 including:- Approved: FCC Form 486 and FRN is approved so invoicing may begin- Partially Approved: FCC Form 486 and FRN is partially approved so invoicing may begin for those FRNs approved.

Explanation of FCDL decision at the FRN level. MR: management reason; CR: cancelled
reason; DR: denial reason.
Funding Request Number from a previous fund year that is related to the FRN.
Reference to a local law or contract to support pricing confidentiality requests.
Number of months for financing related to fiber FRNs.
Annual Interest Rate Associated with a Fiber Application.
Indicates whether the contact has voluntary extensions that can be exercised by the applicant for the FRN.
Funding year for the application.
Balance due payment made at the end of the financing period for fiber installation.

Funding source when the applicant is seeking a state match for fiber FRNs.  The E-rate program will provide additional Category One funding (up to 10%) to match state funding for special construction to connect schools and libraries to high-speed broadband services that meet the FCC's long-term capacity broadband goals.
Indicates whether the FRN pricing must be kept confidential and not disclosed to the public.
Contract type for the FRN including Month-to-Month, Contract or Tariff.
Invoicing may begin for the FRN as there is an approved FCC Form 486.
Fiber type for fiber FRNs including Lit Fiber, Dark Fiber, or Self Provisioned Fiber.
Indicates whether a Funding Request is tied to a contract with a multiple award schedule.
Indicates whether an FCC Form 470 was posted for the services/products associated with the FRN.

Indicates whether the form version of the application is "current" or "original." It can be used to aggregate the data between current and original applications. "Current" is the view of the form processed by USAC. "Original" is the view of the form originally submitted by the applicant upon certification.

domain_metadata.value: This dataset contains information about the Funding Request Number (FRN) listed within each FCC Form 471 and related information from the E-rate Productivity Center (EPC). Use this dataset to answer questions about the individual service type, the quantity of the service requested, which service provider is supplying the service, the length of the contract, the discount of the services received and fiber type information if applicable. All data contained within the FRN information data collection (FCC Form 471) is self-reported by applicants to the E-rate Program.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset field is described with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0 -100%. Any value less than 100% indicates a field with missing values. In most cases, missing values are the result of “not required” fields.

domain_metadata.value: This dataset contains data from the basic information section of each FCC Form 471, including applicant details such as contact information, applicant type, Billed Entity Number (BEN), student count, dollars, and category of service, as well as related information from the E-rate Productivity Center (EPC). Use this dataset to answer questions such as: What is the applicant entity’s student count? What will the category of service funding be used for? What is the contact information of the applicant?  All information within the Basic Information (FCC Form 471) dataset is self-reported by applicants.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset field is described with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0 -100%. Any value less than 100% indicates a field with missing values. In most cases, missing values are the result of “not required” fields.

domain_metadata.value: This dataset combines key fields captured from the E-rate Form 471 (Basic Information, FRN Status, FRN Line Items, Recipients Of Service, and Supplemental Entity Information). Use this dataset to answer questions such as: Who are all the recipients in the E-rate program? What type of service is a particular recipient getting? How much is a recipient paying for a particular services? Who is the service provider for a particular recipient? Is the recipient a Tribal School/Library, Public School/Library, Charter School, etc?

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset field is described with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0 -100%. Any value less than 100% indicates a field with missing values. In most cases, missing values are the result of “not required” fields.

Applicant state.
Unique application number is generated at the time an applicant begins to file FCC Form 471. Applicants can request funding for multiple services under the same application number.

Total rediscount eligible one-time charges of a funding request. This field can be aggregated at an FRN line item level to generate metrics across service type or entities. This field should not be used to generate metrics at FRN  level.
FRN service maximum burstable speed.
Internet download speed unit (e.g. Mbps or Gbps) for FRN line item.

Service purpose for the FRN Line Item. It can be used to filter the records of a particular type of purpose.  There are five purposes: Backbone circuit for consortium that provides connectivity between aggregation points or other non-user facilities; Data Connection between two or more sites entirely within the applicant’s network; Data connection(s) for an applicant’s hub site to an Internet Service Provider or state/regional network where Internet access service is billed separately; and Internet access service with no circuit (data circuit to ISP state/regional network is billed separately).
Units of product or service for the FRN line item.  Examples include: each, dozen, per foot, per hundred feet, or hours.
Indicates whether the service provider provides internet service directly to the School, Library or NIF or if it uses an Internet circuit to a district hub to connect.
Indicates whether the application has been certified in the window.
Pre-discounted eligible monthly charges for the FRN line item.
Indicates whether the equipment has been leased or has a non-purchase agreement for internal connection.
Indicates if the service provider provides basic firewall protection as a standard component of the Internet access for the FRN line item.

Indicates whether the form version of the application is "current" or "original." It can be used to aggregate the data between current and original applications. "Current" is the view of the form processed by USAC. "Original" is the view of the form originally submitted by the applicant upon certification.
Burstable speed unit ( Mbps or Gbps) for FRN line item.
Quantity for the one-time costs for the FRN line item.
Pre-discounted non-recurring charges for the FRN line item.
Manufacturer not included in the drop down list.
Upload speed units ( Mbps or Gbps) for the FRN line item service.
Funding year for the application.
Indicator whether the service provider provides a connection between eligible Schools, Libraries, and NIFs (i.e., a connection that provides a wide area network (WAN)).
Indicates whether the equipment installation is included in the price.
Number of buildings/sites that will use the connections listed in this FRN line item. Options include all buildings/sites listed; one building/site listed; or multiple buildings/sites listed.

domain_metadata.value: This dataset contains information about the FRN line items within each FCC Form 471, including individual product/service data, costs, quantities, and descriptions.   Use this dataset can answer questions about the individual products or services used by the applicant for their broadband connectivity, the cost of individual products or services, and the quantity of individual products that are funded by E-rate.   All FCC Form 471 information contained within the FRN Line Items dataset is self-reported by E-rate applicants.  USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset field is described with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0 to 100 percent. Any value less than 100 percent indicates a field with missing values. In most cases, missing values are the result of “not required” fields.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset field is described with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0 -100%. Any value less than 100% indicates a field with missing values. In most cases, missing values are the result of “not required” fields.

resource.name: Rural Health Care Commitments and Disbursements (FCC Form 462/466/466A)
resource.description: This dataset contains data about funding decisions, total committed amounts, and total disbursement amounts for the Rural Health Care (RHC) Program. The data is collected from the FCC Form 462 (Funding Request Form, Health Care Connect Fund (HCF)), FCC Form 466 (Funding Request and Certification Form, Telecommunications program) and FCC Form 466A (Internet Service Funding Request and Certification Form, Telecommunications program). All information within the FCC Forms 462, 466, and 466A data collection is self-reported by applicants.
columns_name: 498 ID (also called a Service Provider ID or SPIN)
columns_description: Full legal name of a service provider.

A unique nine-digit number assigned to a service provider by USAC when the service provider files an FCC Form 498. Every service provider is required to have a 498 ID in order to participate in any universal service program and/or receive payments from USAC.
Date the funding request was submitted.
Date the funding request was committed.
Date the funding terminates.
Monthly urban rate for the service.  Only applicable to Telecommunications program funding requests.
Upload speed requested by an HCF Program applicant. If “NA,” then relates to service where bandwidth is not applicable, e.g., network equipment.
System-generated longitude of the Participating HCP site address associated with the service request.
Zip code where Participating HCP site is located.
Street address where Participating HCP site is located.
Name of the HCP entity that filed the request seeking funding for supported services.

FRN line number can be used to filter the records associated with a specific FRN, i.e., the FRN Line Number helps to identify a particular record when there are multiple record entries associated with the same FRN, which can occur with HCF Program requests. If field states “unallocated,” then support is not yet allocated to a specific site.
Filing window information associated with submitted funding requests.
Download speed requested by an HCF Program applicant. If “NA,” then relates to service where bandwidth is not applicable, e.g., network equipment.
Unique number assigned by USAC to the Participating HCP receiving services.
Dollars to date paid out by USAC for the funding request.
Date the funding starts.
Monthly rural rate for the service.  Only applicable to Telecommunications program funding requests.
Number of items an applicant is requesting. Not applicable for the Telecommunications program.
Indicates if the HCP site is eligible for support. Each HCP site or location is considered an individual HCP for the purposes of calculating support.
City where Participating HCP site is located.
Indicates the Entity Type receiving service.
System-generated longitude for Filing HCP’s physical address.
City where Filing HCP is located.
Unique number assigned by USAC to the consortium or individual entity that filed the request seeking funding for supported services.

A unique number assigned by USAC for each funding request submitted through FCC Forms 462, 466, and 466A. It can be used as a primary reference to extract additional information related to the funding request.
Indicates the Entity Type filling for service.
Percentage of each qualifying funding request that will be approved for commitment.

Number of service providers that bid on the request for services. A blank field means “not applicable” either because the information is not currently available from the applicant, .e.g., for Telecommunications program requests, or because the applicant claimed a competitive bidding exemption under the HCF Program.  Zero means no bids were received.
Service type for which the funding is requested.
Street address where Filing HCP is located.
Total amount USAC will provide for the funding request.
Indicates the category of expense (e.g. leased/tariffed facilities or services, network equipment) for which the funding is requested. Not applicable for the Telecommunications program.
RHC is comprised of two programs: Health Care Connect Fund (HCF) and Telecommunications program. This field specifies which program the applicant applied for.
Funding year for the application. The RHC funding year runs from July 1 to June 30.
Name of the Participating HCP receiving services.

Portion of a connection that is eligible for support. When a connection is used by both eligible and ineligible sites, an applicant needs to indicate the portion of usage that is eligible for support.
System-generated latitude for the Participating HCP site address associated with the service request.
System-generated latitude for Filing HCP’s physical address.
State where Filing HCP is located.
Indicates whether the funding request is for an individual health care provider (HCP) or a consortium. This field defaults to 'Individual' for the Telecommunications program.
Zip code where Filing HCP is located.
Bandwidth speed requested by applicant.  Bandwidth field will be used for all Telecom applicants, and for HCF applicant only if the bandwidth (upload/download) requested is symmetrical.

Indicates the frequency of expense for the service an applicant is requesting. The applicant may specify the frequency as month, quarter, one-time, or year. This field defaults to "Month" for the Telecommunications program.
State where Participating HCP site is located.
Status of FCC Forms 462, 466, and 466A. Only approved FCC Forms are currently displayed in this dataset.

Indicates if the applicant is seeking a multi-year funding commitment in the HCF Program. However, applicants seeking support for $10,000 or less of annual undiscounted cost are not eligible for multi-year funding commitments. Not applicable for the Telecommunications program.

domain_metadata.value: This data set contains information collected from the FCC Forms 462, 466 and 466A which includes basic information about the applicant and service provider, information regarding the type of service requested, the funding start and end dates and information about the total committed amount and total disbursed amount.  All data contained within the FCC Forms 462 (Funding Request Form, Health Care Connect Fund (HCF) program), 466 (Funding Request and Certification Form, Telecommunications program), 466A (Internet Service Funding Request and Certification Form, Telecommunications program)  is self-reported by applicants to the Rural Health Care (RHC) program.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset field is described with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0 to 100 percent. Any value less than 100 percent indicates a field with missing values.

resource.name: Frequently Asked Questions
E-rate Open Competitive Bidding: Services Requested (FCC Form 470 and Related Information)
resource.description: This dataset contains information about the services requested within each FCC Form 470, including the service type, function, and manufacturer, and related information from the E-rate Productivity Center (EPC).
columns_description: The date the Request for Proposal (RFP) document was uploaded to EPC.
Number of entities served by the service requested.
Description of the function the applicant is requesting, if not listed.
Indicates the function of the funding request number line item service or product.
Link to download a copy of the original submission of the Request for Proposal (RFP).
This unique application number is generated at the time an applicant begins to file FCC Form 470. Applicants request funding for multiple services under the same application number.
Maximum capacity of units desired for the service requested.
Name of the manufacturer if it is not included in the drop down list.
Amount of units of the specific service requested.
Funding request number service type.
Requested manufacturer or equivalent.
Minimum capacity of units desired for the service requested.
Category of service the applicant is applying for.
Unit type of the service requested (e.g. circuits, lines, fiber strands.)
Funding year for the application.
Indicates if the applicant is seeking installation, activation, and initial configuration for the service requested.
Indicates whether a Request for Proposal (RFP) document was provided for the services requested.

Indicates whether the form version of the application is "current" or "original." It can be used to aggregate the data between current and original applications. "Current" is the view of the form processed by USAC. "Original" is the view of the form originally submitted by the applicant upon certification.
Indicates if the applicant is seeking maintenance and technical Support for the service requested.

domain_metadata.value: This dataset contains information about the services requested within each FCC Form 470, including the service type, function, and manufacturer, and related information from the E-rate Productivity Center (EPC). Use this dataset to answer questions such as: Which category of service is the applicant is applying for? What will the service be used for? What is the service quantity the applicant is requesting? All data contained within the Service Requested (FCC Form 470) dataset is self-reported by applicants.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset field is described with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0 -100%. Any value less than 100% indicates a field with missing values. In most cases, missing values are the result of “not required” fields.

resource.name: E-rate Supplemental Entity Information
resource.description: This data set contains E-rate Productivity Center (EPC) information about schools, libraries, school districts, library systems, consortia, and non-instructional facilities (NIFs). For Annexes information, please refer to the "E-rate Supplemental Entity Information: Annexes" dataset.
columns_name: Main Library Branch School District Number
Main Library Branch School District Name
Does this organization have an endowment?
ESA School District with no Schools
columns_description: Indicates the date and time the profile of the entity was last modified in EPC.
The total number of full-time students for the school.

Code assigned by the Institute for Museum and Library Services (IMLS) that identifies the population density of the library’s location. Libraries that are located in the IMLS locale code of 11-City, Large; 12-City, Midsize; or 21-Suburb are eligible for a higher pre-discount budget than libraries with other locale codes.
Indicates the entity number of the school district in which the main library branch is located.
Indicates the name of the school district in which the main library branch is located.
System-generated longitude coordinate of the entity based on the physical address.
General Contact of the entity.
Entity’s website.
Entity’s phone number.
Four-digit ZIP code extension if applicable.
State of the entity’s mailing address.
Additional address information if applicable.
U.S. state or territory where the entity is located.
City where the entity is located.

Ten-digit number assigned by the FCC to each
organization for all transactions with the FCC.
Use the FCC's Commission Registration System (CORES) to register or search for an FCC registration number.
The number of the parent entity.
Indicates whether the organization has an endowment.
Code assigned by NCES for the school district.
Total interior area of the library measured in square footage.
Library FSCS sequence code is a unique 3-digit suffix that distinguishes outlets associated with a library system.
City of the entity’s mailing address.
Name of entity.
A school that has yet to be fully constructed, often requiring estimated student counts.
The peak number of part-time students for the school.
System-generated latitude coordinate of the entity based on the physical address.
County of the entity’s mailing address.
Indicates the approved percentage of a school in the Community Eligibility Program (CEP).
LEA code for the school district.
Indicates the FSCS of the library.
Indicates if school district is a public school district.
Email address for the entity's general contact.
The number of the entity assigned by USAC.
A Pre-K school.
A facility with a comprehensive child development program that serves preschool-age children and their families.
The parent entity type including consortium, school district, and/or library system. The parent entity type is listed as a school or library if there is a child NIF.
A public school.
Code assigned by the National Center for Education Statistics (NCES) for the state.
System-generated urban/rural status for the entity based on the physical address, latitude, and longitude.
User-entered urban/rural status for the entity.
Name of the account administrator in EPC.
Mailing address of the entity.

An Educational State Agency (ESA) comprised entirely of non-instructional facilities (NIFs), from which its staff is based. It may run education programs in facilities that are not recognized as elementary or secondary schools. Classifying such an entity as a school in EPC is necessary to be able to enter the total student count for all of its member school districts.

The type of the entity including school district, 
school, library system, library, consortium, and
non-instructional facility (NIF).
Indicates if the library has not been fully constructed.
A school operated by an Educational Service Agency to provide specialized services such as Vocational or Special Education.
Indicates the e-mail address of the person who last modified the entity’s information in EPC.

Number of students or calculated number of students eligible for the National School
Lunch Program (NSLP).
The total number of part-time students for the school.
Code assigned by the state for a school.
Four-digit ZIP code extension if applicable.
County where the entity is located.
Street address where the entity is located.
Indicates if the school is enrolled in the Community Eligibility Program (CEP).
Indicates if the library is part of an educational institution.
A private school.
Indicates if the library is a research library.
A NIF which is (and should be) labeled as a school in EPC, but usually has within it a primary or secondary education program.
Indicates if the consortium is a state-wide consortium.
A school/library is listed as independent (Yes) if it is not part of a school district/library system.
Indicates if the library is public.
A school operated by a Tribal government.
Indicates if the consortium is part of a non-profit purchasing group.
Zip code for the entity.
Indicates if the library is maintained by a tribal government.
Indicates if the library system consists exclusively of private libraries.

The status of the FCC Form 498 submitted for the entity. Every service provider is required to have a 498 ID in order to participate in any universal service program and/or receive payments from USAC.
Indicates if the library is part of a state library agency.
This field is blank if the entity does not have a parent. If an entity has more than one parent, the entity is listed multiple times.
ZIP code of the entity’s mailing address.
Indicates if school district is a private school district.
Indicates if an organization is active (open) or closed.
Indicates if the consortium is a state library agency.
Indicates if the library is private.
A school operated by the Bureau of Indian Education (BIE).
Code assigned by NCES for private schools.
Additional address information if applicable.
Indicates if the library is a mobile library.
An institution for adult education.
Indicates if a school district consists exclusively of charter schools.
A charter school.
Indicates if the library system consists exclusively of public libraries.
Indicates the school’s alternative discount method such as sibling match, survey, or combination (not CEP).
Indicates if the library is a kiosk.
Indicates if the consortium is a state education agency.
A dormitory for housing students.
Indicates if the consortium is a state agency other than the state agencies listed above.
An established ESA serving as a consortium leader, aggregating demand and assisting in bulk purchases on behalf of some or all of the school districts and/or libraries in its service area.
Code assigned by NCES for the public school building.
Indicates if a school district identifies as having an ESA support its member schools.
Indicates if the library is the main branch of the library system in which it is located. Main branch will also be listed as “Yes” for independent libraries.

domain_metadata.value: This data set contains E-rate Productivity Center (EPC) information about schools, libraries, school districts, library systems, consortia, and non-instructional facilities (NIFs). For data about annexes, please reference the data set titled “E-rate Annex Information”.  The data set is updated nightly and includes the latest updates to EPC entity profiles as of 9 p.m. ET from the previous day. Parent and child relationships are included in the data set for each entity. If a given entity has more than one parent (e.g., an entity that is a member of two consortia) the entity will be listed multiple times. The data set includes a field for entity status which indicates whether the entity is active or closed.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset is then noted with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0% - 100%. Any metric less than 100% means that applicants left certain fields blank when reporting the information to USAC.

resource.name: USAC Open Data Release Notes
E-rate Request for Discount on Services: Recipients Of Service (FCC Form 471 and Related Information)
resource.description: This dataset contains information about the entities who receive the service and associated cost allocations included within each FCC Form 471, and related information from the E-rate Productivity Center (EPC).
columns_description: Entity number for the recipient of service.
Funding request line item number.
Unique funding request number (FRN) associated with the FCC Form 471.
Email address of the main contact listed in the FCC Form 471 application.
Unique billed entity number associated with the entity name on the FCC Form 471.
Unique application number generated at the time applicants begin to file the FCC Form 471. Applicants can request funding for multiple services under the same application number.
State of the applicant.
Indicates whether the application has been certified during the FCC Form 471 application filing window.
Funding year for the FCC Form 471.
Name of the billed entity.
Number of lines allocated to a recipient of service for Category One services.
Recipient's organization name.
Cost allocation for the recipient of service for Category Two products and services.
Field indicates whether the form version of the application is "current" or "original."

domain_metadata.value: This dataset contains information about the entities who receive the service and associated cost allocations included within each FCC Form 471, and related information from the E-rate Productivity Center (EPC). Use this dataset to answer questions such as: Which entities use E-rate funds for their connectivity services? What are the associated cost allocations included within each FCC Form 471? All information within the Recipients of Service (FCC Form 471) dataset is self-reported by applicants.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset field is described with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0 -100%. Any value less than 100% indicates a field with missing values. In most cases, missing values are the result of “not required” fields.

resource.name: High Cost: Connect America Fund Broadband Map (CAF Map)
resource.description: This dataset serves as the source of information for the Connect America Fund broadband map (CAF Map), which displays the geographic areas that are eligible for CAF support, as well as the specific fixed locations where carriers participating in the program have built out broadband service. The information in this map comes directly from the carriers, which submit broadband deployment data annually using USAC’s High Cost Universal Broadband (HUBB) portal. CAF Map is based on data certified in the HUBB as of 3/6/2019.
columns_description: Standard name used to identify a study area. Typically, the carrier name is the same as the company name.
Individual High Cost fund under which the carrier deployed. See High Cost Funds Glossary for details.
Percent of locations a carrier is required to deploy based on current program year milestone. For RBE the obligations are at SAC level and the deadline dates are not same as filing year end dates.
Date the deployment occurred.
Amount of funding disbursed to carriers by state.
Unique number assigned to each ETC based on its service area. A carrier with multiple service areas within a single state will have multiple SAC.
Broadband speed that meets the required minimum standard (varies by fund).
Longitude of the deployment location.
Number of locations the carrier is obligated to deploy to for the whole fund.
Number of household being served within a location.
Latitude of the deployment location.
Zip Code of the deployment location.
Year the deployment occurred.
Address of the deployment location.
Company name of the affiliated carrier, or in its absence, carrier name.
Census block of the deployment location.
City of the deployment location.
State of the deployment location.
Date by which carriers must certify their deployments for that filing year in order to meet their milestone requirement.

domain_tags: connect america fund broadband loop support

domain_metadata.value: This dataset serves as the source of information for the Connect America Fund Broadband Map (CAF Map), which displays the geographic areas that are eligible for CAF support, as well as the specific fixed locations where carriers participating in the program have built out broadband service. The information in this map comes directly from the carriers, which submit broadband deployment data annually using USAC’s High Cost Universal Broadband (HUBB) portal. CAF Map is based on data certified in the HUBB as of 3/6/2019.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset field is described with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0 to 100 percent. Any value less than 100 percent indicates a field with missing values.

Use this dataset to answer questions such as: What are the individual service types? What quantity of service did the applicant request? Which service provider is supplying service and what is the length of the contract? What discount did the applicant receive on services? Did the applicant request funding for fiber? Each dataset field is described with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0 -100%. Any value less than 100% indicates a field with missing values. In most cases, missing values are the result of “not required” fields.

domain_metadata.value: This dataset contains information about the discount calculations included within each FCC Form 471 and related information from the E-rate Productivity Center (EPC). Use this dataset to answer questions like: What are the schools and their student count that determine an FRN’s discount rate? Which entities are rural? Which school district is used to calculate the discount rate for each library? All data contained within the Discount Calculations (FCC Form 471) dataset is self-reported by applicants to the E-rate Program.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset field is described with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0 to 100 percent. Any value less than 100 percent indicates a field with missing values. In most cases, missing values are the result of “not required” fields.

Indicates whether the form version of the application is "current" or "original." It can be used to aggregate the data between current and original applications. "Current" is the view of the form processed by USAC. "Original" is the view of the form originally submitted by the applicant upon certification.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. resource.name: Rural Health Care Posted Services (FCC Form 461/465)
resource.description:
This dataset contains data allowing service providers to view service request information provided by individual Health Care Providers (HCPs) and consortia applying for funding through the Rural Health Care (RHC) Program. The data is collected from the FCC Forms 461 and 465, which includes the service request information. 

All data contained within the FCC Form 461 (Request for Services Form, Health Care Connect Fund (HCF) program) and 465 (Description of Services Requested & Certification Form, Telecommunications program) is self-reported by applicants to RHC.

resource.name: E-rate Supplemental Information: Annexes

domain_metadata.value: This dataset contains information about annexes from the E-rate Productivity Center (EPC).  An annex is a secondary site of an individual school that is in a different physical location than the primary facility, but is still considered part of the same school. For data about entities, please reference the dataset titled “E-rate Entity Information.”   All information within the Annex data collection is self-reported by applicants.

USAC is committed to sharing the highest quality data possible. We conduct a full analysis of all datasets to determine if they are complete prior to publishing. Each dataset field is described with a “field completeness” metric that ranges from 0 -100%. Any value less than 100% indicates a field with missing values. In most cases, missing values are the result of “not required” fields.
